Articles.Content:
After dropping off my Mako-inspired rover onto Laythe, I began to wonder.... What If I could make a version that flies?

The project idea began as Dropship One. The closest thing I can get to an IVA type ship which is aesthetically pleasing and capable of SSTO (barely)...

The first prototype started out as an atmospheric transport, capable of transporting 4 Kerbals to at least halfway around Kerbin.

Here is a closer look at the interior of this prototype:

The final iteration of Dropship One, has SABRE-inspired SSTO features (difficult to get there as you have about 50 fuel and oxidizer left), seats 4 Kerbals, and has its balance issues solved which was previously present in the other prototypes.

In the rear of this craft, we have a ladder 'ramp' to gain access.

Once on board, we have a comfortably lit crew cargo area for 4 Kerbals.

Here, we have various instruments to measure the environment outside the craft.

As we sit down, we can see the battery packs that charges the various components of the craft. We also see the door to the 'cockpit' (protip: it's not really the cockpit, it's for aesthetic purposes)

Here we get a good view of the takeoff, and what it would appear semi-full of passengers...

Of course upcoming projects include a 10 Kerbal carrier, which is capable of SSTO (with excessive use of clipping). However, unless you are going to load up the craft with 10 Kerbals at one go, it's a glorious waste of time. (currently under testing)

Edit: Craft file link updated, sorry for the non-functioning link earlier

Craft File DropShip Two (updated version): https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/16683090/KSP/Dropship%20Two.rar

Hotkeys:

1: Toggle LV-909 engines

2: Toggles jet engines

Edit: for those of you who want the rover too:

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/16683090/KSP/0_2%20Rover.rar

Edited May 31, 2013 by Levelord
Thats really great, nice work!
This deserves an "insayan". Haven't seen something comparable recently. Most of all, it's the combination between usability and nice looking that makes it unique. Good job!
I really like the seating area, almost looks like iva in some of the pictures.
Creativity at it finest good job man... i really like the Mako style rover can i get one..?
Seconded, that rover is sexy.
oh yes. I love it. so much win (drools) I think this concept of interior IVA space could be applied to a modular base as well... hmm...
Nice! Gee, now I have the want to build a dropship.
Very interesting, IÃ‚Â´ll maybe get few pieces for Project BABYLON usage

Do you also have a .craft for the rover? It looks sexy.

Really nice looking!

Can you please post the .craft file?

I'd love to use both on Laythe (I've never managed to make a working plane)

Great stuff, really reminds me of Aliens!

Cupcake...
That's a damn fine rover you got there! As many others have requested, can you upload a .craft file? I'd be much gratefull!
Download link isn't working for me.
You have to validate your account before other people can access it.
This is a thing of beauty.

Thanks for the support and interest. I apologize if the links didn't work previously, I'm new to mediafire... So I guess I'll revert back to using my Dropbox for now.

The OP has been updated to include working links, plus the rover for those of you who requested it

Edited May 31, 2013 by Levelord

I managed to grab it last night.

I'm using it in various iterations of universes, including my new Sci-Fi universe called Thunderbirds Are Go (see below )!

I absolutely love this thing! Brilliant and inspiring work!

I just posted a slight modification of the Gladius that could serve as a cousin to this dropship. It's smaller, but this one is lighter, I think.

Rune. And they both look quite cool IMO.
These things are really cool!! Hmm, wonder if i can make a Halo Pelican in a similar way.....

Today I did a mission to Laythe, my go-to planets of all planets moon to visit. I modified the dropship to carry a small rover for *SCIENCE!* missions.

We launch the dropship into orbit with the rover payload

Next we launch the interplanetary tug and rendezvous for the burn.

Now, on arrival to Laythe, we spotted a small pond sitting in the middle of a large land mass we were crossing over. Being inquisitive, we decided to check it out.

Before we detach the rover though, we perform some SCIENCE! Then we make a short drive to the small pond for MOAR SCIENCE.

Current scientific consensus is that there are no whales in this pond. Also current scientific data suggests that the pond is great for swimming! Blub blub blub blub...

Edited June 18, 2013 by Levelord
Could you remove the modded oa

Can you Make a 100% stock version of the dropship and the rover dropship variant as the mod that uses the part in it doesn't exists any more or i cant find it. as other wise i can only get the rover to work with the current version. many thanks.

Can you Make a 100% stock version of the dropship and the rover dropship variant as the mod that uses the part in it doesn't exists any more or i cant find it. as other wise i can only get the rover to work with the current version. many thanks.

Check the day this was created, you just did one hell of a necro. This ship is a couple of years (and several game versions) old. The part you are looking for is the old Mk3 cabin, which was replaced long, long ago.

Check the day this was created, you just did one hell of a necro. This ship is a couple of years (and several game versions) old. The part you are looking for is the old Mk3 cabin, which was replaced long, long ago.

I remember this craft! I remember thinking I would never be able to make something like that. Good times man. Good times.
